marketingBullets.value: Hex nuts are designed to mechanically join materials by fastening to a bolt
Zinc finish offers moderate corrosion resistance
Can be installed by screwing onto exposed thread by hand and tightening with a wrench
Safe for use in most general home and commercial applications
Recommended for use with bolts and washers of a similar size and finish
Parts feature USS coarse 1/4-in-20 screw thread

product.romanceCopy: Hex nuts are used to prevent shear movement and tension when adhering facing materials together with machine bolts. Hex nuts are commonly used in wood to wood, wood to metal, and metal to metal applications. Grade 2 zinc steel hex nuts are recommended for most general uses and are corrosion resistant. Be sure to pre-drill any holes and to use washers and bolts that are a similar grade and finish.

marketingBullets.value: USS coarse hex nuts are designed to be used with machine bolts to adhere facing materials while preventing tension and shear movement
Zinc-plated finish offers moderate corrosion resistance
When installing, do not over-tighten; over-tightening risks stripping of threads
Be sure to use a nut that is consistent in thread size and finish with your other fasteners
These hex nuts are recommended for use with a 1/2-in bolt
3 pieces per retail package

product.romanceCopy: Hex nuts are to be used with machine bolts to adhere facing materials to prevent tension and shear movement. They are specifically useful in wood to wood, wood to metal, or metal to metal applications. Hex nuts made with Grade 2 zinc are recommended for most general uses and offer moderate corrosion resistance. For your safety, do not weld zinc products as they may release toxic fumes when superheated. When installing, be sure to pre-drill any holes and to use washers and bolts that are a similar grade and finish. These hex nuts measure 1/2-in wide. They feature 13 screw threads per inch.
